title: Jisoo Gives Jonathan Anderson’s Dior Its Onstage Debut
description: The singer wore a pink silk ensemble during a performance for Blackpink’s world tour.
excerpt: The singer wore a pink silk ensemble during a Blackpink world tour performance in Los Angeles.
text: THE RUNDOWNJisoo wore custom Dior by Jonathan Anderson during the “Deadline” Blackpink world tour.The singer is the first person to wear Anderson’s Dior on stage. The pink silk set is a sneak preview of Anderson’s womenswear for the brand, which has yet to debut.Now that Jonathan Anderson has officially made his Dior debut, the custom celebrity look floodgates are open. Last night, Jisoo from Blackpink stepped out onstage in a bubblegum pink two-piece silk ensemble, making her the first to wear custom Dior by Jonathan Anderson on stage. The bow top and pleated skirt were complemented by a classic pair of Dior riding boots—a perfectly playful and on-the-nose look for one of the world’s biggest pop stars. Courtesy of YG EntertainmentNot to mention, it’s one of the few glimpses we’ve had of Anderson’s eagerly-awaited Dior womenswear, which will bow at Paris fashion week in the fall. That doesn’t mean we haven’t seen anything yet—only that the excitement is bubbling. At the men’s show in June, Sabrina Carpenter, Mia Goth, and Rihanna arrived in their own custom womenswear looks. Francois Durand//Getty ImagesSabrina Carpenter. Pascal Le Segretain//Getty ImagesMia Goth. Carpenter looked polished in a sharply tailored gray iteration of Dior’s famous Bar jacket (which was also reinterpreted in the opening look on the men’s runway). Goth wore a light blue silk pleated top tucked into a gray pleated asymmetric skirt and Lady Dior handbag, while Rihanna sported a menswear-inspired three-piece suit with a pistachio-green vest and contrasting print overcoat. Each showcased a possibility of what we can look forward to in a few short months.
html:
THE RUNDOWN

  • Jisoo wore custom Dior by Jonathan Anderson during the “Deadline” Blackpink world tour.
  • The singer is the first person to wear Anderson’s Dior on stage.
  • The pink silk set is a sneak preview of Anderson’s womenswear for the brand, which has yet to debut.

Now that Jonathan Anderson has officially made his Dior debut, the custom celebrity look floodgates are open. Last night, Jisoo from Blackpink stepped out onstage in a bubblegum pink two-piece silk ensemble, making her the first to wear custom Dior by Jonathan Anderson on stage. The bow top and pleated skirt were complemented by a classic pair of Dior riding boots—a perfectly playful and on-the-nose look for one of the world’s biggest pop stars.

Not to mention, it’s one of the few glimpses we’ve had of Anderson’s eagerly-awaited Dior womenswear, which will bow at Paris fashion week in the fall. That doesn’t mean we haven’t seen anything yet—only that the excitement is bubbling. At the men’s show in June, Sabrina Carpenter, Mia Goth, and Rihanna arrived in their own custom womenswear looks.

Sabrina Carpenter. 

Mia Goth. 

Carpenter looked polished in a sharply tailored gray iteration of Dior’s famous Bar jacket (which was also reinterpreted in the opening look on the men’s runway). Goth wore a light blue silk pleated top tucked into a gray pleated asymmetric skirt and Lady Dior handbag, while Rihanna sported a menswear-inspired three-piece suit with a pistachio-green vest and contrasting print overcoat. Each showcased a possibility of what we can look forward to in a few short months.
